item.title: Irish fintech NomuPay lands $40M at a $290M valuation from SoftBank
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description: As global trade evolves, there’s an increasing demand for diverse cross-border payment options. That’s why an Irish-based fintech startup called NomuPay has raised $40 million in a Series C round from SB Payment Service (SBPS), a subsidiary of Japanese telco giant SoftBank Corp, at a valuation of $290 million. NomuPay makes it easier for merchants […]

item.title: Valla raises $2.7M to make legal recourse more accessible to employees
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Even for someone with a cushy tech job, the prospect of going against their company is daunting. That bothered Shell so much that in 2022, she launched Valla, which seeks to make legal support more accessible to workers.

item.title: Console raises $6.2M from Thrive to free IT teams from mundane tasks with AI
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Console's mission is to help IT teams reduce mundane, repetitive tasks, thereby freeing up time for help desk professionals to work on more strategic and sophisticated projects.

item.title: Former DreamWorks CEO Jeffrey Katzenberg co-leads $15.5M Series A for AI video ad platform
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Creatify's AdMax platform uses AI to quickly generate dozens of video advertisements, which are geared toward social media marketing

item.title: Microsoft Bing gets a free Sora-powered AI video generator
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Microsoft Bing announced Monday that it is introducing the Bing Video Creator to its app, which uses OpenAI's Sora model to let users generate videos from text prompts.

item.title: Snowflake to acquire database startup Crunchy Data
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Cloud data platform Snowflake announced its intent to acquire Crunchy Data, a Postgres database partner, late this afternoon.

item.title: Digg’s founders explain how they’re building a site for humans in the AI era
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The rebooted version of social site Digg aims to bring back the spirit of the old web.

item.title: Chatbot platform Character.AI unveils video generation, social feeds
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Character.AI's new multimedia features include AvatarFX, plus Scenes and Streams, which allow users to create videos featuring their characters and then share them on a new social feed.

item.title: Elon Musk’s Neuralink closes a $650M Series E
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Elon Musk’s brain computer interface startup Neuralink closed a $650 million funding round, the company announced in a blog post on Monday. The Series E fundraise included investors such as ARK Invest, Founders Fund, Sequoia Capital, and Thrive Capital, among others. Neuralink last raised a $280 million Series D funding round in 2023, with an […]

item.title: Google Glass is back in the AI glasses game with Android XR smart glasses
item.dc:creator: Maggie Stamets, TC Video
item.description: Remember Google Glass and the reign of the “glasshole”? Well, Google’s giving face tech another shot with Android XR glasses that look like actual glasses this time.

item.title: Salesforce buys Moonhub, a startup building AI tools for hiring
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: Updated 1:13 p.m. Pacific: A Salesforce spokesperson told TechCrunch that Moonhub has not, in fact, been acquired (by the company’s definition of the term). Rather, Moonhub is shutting down, and only some of the company’s team — not the whole team, as MoonHub implied in its post about the news — will be joining Salesforce. […]

item.title: Chime, last valued at $25B, aims for $11B in upcoming IPO
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Chime, whose pending IPO is expected to be one of 2025’s blockbuster hits, issued a share price range on Monday of $24 to $26. That a market cap of up to $11.2 billion. At the midrange, the company will raise $800 million for itself and a handful of investors, including European VC powerhouse Cathay Innovation, […]

item.title: Breakneck data center growth challenges Microsoft’s sustainability goals
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Microsoft's sustainability goals are imperiled by its push into AI and cloud services.

item.title: IBM acquires data analysis startup Seek AI, opens AI accelerator in NYC
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: IBM on Monday said that it has acquired Seek AI, an AI platform that allows users to ask questions about enterprise data using natural language, for an undisclosed sum.

item.title: Elon Musk’s xAI reportedly looks to raise $300M in tender offer
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: Billionaire Elon Musk's AI startup, xAI, is reportedly launching a $300 million share sale that values the company at $113 billion.

item.title: Tesla files new ‘Robotaxi’ trademark applications after prior attempt stalls
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Tesla has filed trademark applications for the term "Tesla Robotaxi," after the company's previous attempts to secure trademarks for its planned self-driving vehicle service hit roadblocks.

item.title: Vanta bug exposed customers’ data to other customers
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: The compliance company said the customer data exposure was caused by a product change.

item.title: How AI chatbots keep you chatting
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Millions of people are now using ChatGPT as a therapist, career advisor, fitness coach, or sometimes just a friend to vent to. In 2025, it’s not uncommon to hear about people spilling intimate details of their lives into an AI chatbot’s prompt bar, but also relying on the advice it gives back. Humans are starting […]

item.title: NSO Group asks judge for new trial, calling $167 million in damages ‘outrageous’
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: The spyware maker claims the damages it was ordered to pay are "excessive," and that the jury wanted to “bankrupt” the company.

item.title: Elon Musk says XChat is rolling out to all, but questions remain about its alleged security
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Elon Musk announced that a new version of X's direct messaging feature, XChat, was rolling out with support for features like vanishing messages, encryption, and the ability to share files, alongside its audio and video calling support.
